inclusion.criterion: audiogram performed as standard of care for evaluation and management of chronic tinnitus
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: transdermal lidocaine patches will be administered to the participant's torso, either the upper back or chest
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patches will be applied first thing in the morning to these areas daily, and kept on for twelve hours
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: all relevant patient information including symptoms checklists, results of TFI, and other important patient care information will be recorded in the UC Davis Electronic Medical Record (EMR)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: study drug will be prescribed by a physician in the Department of the Otolaryngology at UC Davis, to be filled at the pharmacy of the participant's choosing
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the patient data will also be transposed into a REDCap database for patient tracking, evaluation, and analysis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: each participant will continue with either the baseline dosage or an increased dosage based upon his or her response and tolerance to the drug
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: after one month of treatment, the participant will be called by the research team
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the participant will first be asked if he or she would like to withdrawal from the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the participant will then be asked to voice any and all concerns he or she may have up to that point in the study
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Previous exposure to lidocaine as a treatment for tinnitus
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Taking medications, herbal remedies and supplements that may interact with lidocaine,
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 19-year-old Hispanic female in her second pregnancy, presenting with mild headache and leg swelling. She has no specific past medical issues and only uses prenatal vitamins.
